humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions two areas of invasive lobular carcinoma with sizes of 2.8 cm and 1.8 cm. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, which is 2.8 cm in this case. This falls under the T2 category, which includes tumors that are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the predicted T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, there are two invasive lobular carcinomas with sizes of 2.8 cm and 1.8 cm. The larger of the two tumors is used to determine the T stage. Therefore, since the larger tumor is 2.8 cm, the T stage is T2.
